alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hooker; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 7:43PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherry, northeastern Grant and northwestern Hooker Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 642 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles southwest of Medicine Lake, or 35 miles southeast of Gordon, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whitman, Speckel Meir Lake, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Round Lake, Hire, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Sevenmile Hill and Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 157 and 164. Highway 61 between mile markers 175 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
